node.title: Brooklyn Zelenka at Speakeasy JS, Jan 22nd, 2021

node.plaintext:
Brooklyn Zelenka presented the work we're doing at Fission at Speakeasy JS
[https://speakeasyjs.com/]  which is "the meetup for ü•º mad science, üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
hacking, and üß™ experiments". 

WebNative: How to put a full stack directly in the browser
Slides are available on Notist ¬ª
[https://noti.st/expede/lZJZIu/webnative-how-to-put-a-full-stack-directly-in-the-browser]
Yes we have stickers
[https://shop.fission.codes/collections/stickers-prints/products/speakeasyjs-jan-2021-js-se-stickers?variant=37714267766952]
: we made a special edition of JavaScript and Speakeasy JS related stickers.
Code SPEAKEASYJS  for a limited number of free sticker packs available (just pay
shipping to wherever you are).

Thanks Feross [https://feross.org/]  for organizing!

Video
Visit the Fission Vimeo account for all of our videos
[https://vimeo.com/fission], or subscribe to our YouTube channel
[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkf7isShsKRvQl2J7vz5EaA/featured].
node.html:
Brooklyn Zelenka presented the work we're doing at Fission at Speakeasy JS which is "the meetup for ü•º mad science, üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è hacking, and üß™ experiments".

WebNative: How to put a full stack directly in the browser

Yes we have stickers: we made a special edition of JavaScript and Speakeasy JS related stickers. Code SPEAKEASYJS for a limited number of free sticker packs available (just pay shipping to wherever you are).

Thanks Feross for organizing!

Video

Visit the Fission Vimeo account for all of our videos, or subscribe to our YouTube channel.
